Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 is an affordable compact camera equipped with a long zoom and many useful features to let you turn your moments into memorable ones.
Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55: Design
Dressed in the complete black body, the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 has a front metallic body, and its sides and back covered with plastic. It is not as sleek and sexy as the Cyber-shot T-series nor as compact as the W-series, but it looks sturdy and serious. Due to the long zoom lens, the body is not ultra compact but would still fit in your trousers pocket unless you wear those tight EMO jeans. The build quality is excellent for its class and it is also a bit hefty at 198g approximately (with battery and memory card).
Controls placement is not much an issue and very easy to get us ... ed to. On top of the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 is a small power switch flushed with the surface, a shutter-release button with the zoom-ring, and a mode dial. The flash on the front is easy to block with fingers if not careful when it’s fired. The lens barrel covers almost half of its front and its AF-assist lamp on the corner is well-positioned as fingers would hardly find its way there.
The back of the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 is dominated by its large 3-inch LCD screen which is bright under sunlight and on its right, there is a circular 4-way directional key with the centre select button and three dedicated shortcuts – playback, menu and delete. A four-way controller changes can change Display settings, activate Smile shutter, changes Self timer and adjust the Flash. One slight issue here is the buttons placement at the back are a bit too cramped and are positioned a bit too far down which makes single handed operation slightly challenging at times. The bottom has a battery cum memory card compartment, a proprietary AV/data cable port and a tripod mount.
We are no strangers to Sony cameras, so we feel right at home using the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55. The icon-driven menu interface with tab-browsing is easy to navigate and each accompanying text for each feature made it easier to use. Even though we have to get to menu first to change commonly used settings like ISO and exposure, the menu is quite intuitive and is easy to get along. Even for first time users, this non-touchscreen interface with its accompanying explanatory-text for each features would not be an issue.
Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55: Features
The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 is a 14.1Mp camera that uses a CCD sensor and is powered by a powerful 10x Sony’s G lens with a focal range of 25mm-250mm in 35mm term. It uses the BIONZ CCD sensor instead of the CMOS sensor found on other Cyber-shot models like Sony WX1 or TX7. Sony uses Optical Steady Shot image stabilization to reduce hand-shake effect on the images while shooting- it is available for while shooting still images and videos. It has a large 3-inch LCD screen and it supports 720p HD video recording. Sony includes its famous Sweep Panorama feature that enables shooting effortless panoramic images just by holding the shutter button and panning the camera either horizontally or vertically.
To make shooting with the Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 easier, Sony included shooting modes like Intelligent Auto, Easy Mode and eleven scene modes. It also included the usual Face Detection feature with ability to find up to eight faces and there is also a Smile shutter plus Self Portrait Timer.
The Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 has Program Auto to let you adjust ISO, white balance, AF points, light metering and exposure values. Its ISO speed ranges include There is also Sony’s Dynamic Range Optimisation to bring out more shadow detail. To tinker more with the controls, there is a full manual shooting option that enable shooting with various shutter speeds and two-step aperture that ranges from F3.5 to F5.5. At wide angle, it also has option to shoot at F8 aperture stop. The included exposure bracketing feature which is a useful feature is also rarely seen on a sub 15k camera.
The Sony H55 can also record HD videos (720p) with mono audio and optical... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very easy to use and has plenty of features
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy point and click, and great video.
Cons: battery use display is not proportional.
I bought this camera just before going on a trip to Paris. I was quite pleased with the performance of the camera. I could basically point and shoot just about anything. Sometimes I switched to scene or manual mode, but it does a pretty good job of recognizing what you want to and picks the mode automatically.
My only concern is the battery. It lasts a long time but the usage display is not proportional to how much time you have left. I would recommend making sure you get the extra battery so you don't get stuck on top of l'Arc De Triomphe with a dead battery, like me!!
The video recording feature is also very good. Its hi def, and gets good quality. We used it to record ... sports, etc.
The drag-panoramic works pretty well but it works best for landscapes. If you try to get a person in the shot, the person may look a bit distorted because of the relative closeness to the shutter compared with the landscape.
I did a little experiement and took a 30 second exposure of the night sky on a tripod. It actually worked very well and got a nice shot of Orion. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My wife and I were looking for a small (pocket size) camera with high resolution and long zoom. If you done any searching yourself, you know that small size and long zoom don't usually go hand in hand. After doing a lot of research, we found and opted for this camera. 14.1 Megapixels is top-of-the-line for point and shoot cameras, and 10x zoom is fantastic for this size camera. While Sony may not be as much of a camera name brand as say, Nikon or Canon, this camera is quite impressive in it's own right. Other perks include the large 3 LCD display, panorama shoot mode, and HD Video. I also enjoy the ability to use SD cards, as opposed to having to buy all new Sony media (Memory Stick Pro). This will be used mostly for travel, leisure, and family photos, in addition to semi-pro applic ... ations through my videography business. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price for the quality and its simplicity to use
Cons: I'd ahve liked to have had at least a 4GB SD/MS card
The DSC-H55 Cybershot demonstrates quality, solid results and simplicity CAN be had. There are MANY features most typical users wouldn't mess with, but you CAN get great results with it's simple automatic settings/monitoring features. Along with Sony adopting the SDHC cards WITH the MemoryStick Pro Duo format, they've added CHOICES of media. No longer is Sony only proprietary format media use only. The upgrade to the WideAngle G-Lens (found on DSLRs) coupled with 14.1MegaPixels and HD video, gave me crisp, clear, true to color shots quickly and painlessly. Just when I thought they couldn't to much more, moving from my DSC-W290, I was proven wrong. This camera ... has been great on battery life, ease of use and some things I haven't played with yet. HD video was surprising when I found that the shake factor was removed when playing directly from the camera to an HDTV. My overall view, I guess, would be... if you want an excellent camera on a budget, this model delivers! It proves that quality, solid construction and consistent results can be had without breaking the bank. I added an example the first pictures taken with auto, even though the image most likely will be dialed back for the web. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: The Sony H55 is a GREAT little camera.
Item.Review:
Pros: The features.
Cons: The manual is on a CD.
The Sony H55 is a GREAT little camera. I bought the camera because I was going on vacation and wanted a better camera than the one I had. I sure is better than the old one. Here is what I like about the camera. It is small and can fit in a shirt pocket. The display screen shows you all of the information that you need such as ISO settings, flash setting, how many pictures are left on your SDHC card, battery time remaining battery time remaining. There is an auto shut off if you leave the camera on and that will save battery usage. The 10 times optical zoom range is really nice going from 25mm to 250mm. That is a BIG plus for a small camera.
I don't really make videos but I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the ... video. You might want to read what others have written about the video quality since this is not something that I know a lot about.
One of the draw backs is that the manual is on a CD. When I was on vacation I accidentally messed up the white balance and was not sure as to get it working correctly. I missed a few good pictures but once I was settled down in my hotel room I was quickly able to figure out what the problem was and how to correct it. The easy menu made it quick for me to fix that little problem. You should buy an extra battery and SDHC card because the battery might not last too long when making videos. I bought an extra SDHC card just in case the first one failed. You can take 611 photos on one 4GB SDHC card at highest resolution. That is a ton of photos in my opinion.
So in summary this is a GOOD camera for a small price. Wait for it to go on sale like I did and it will be better!
I only rate a product 5 if it deserves to be a 5 and the H55 so far has been good. I have had it one month and so far nothing has gone bad with the camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: auto and panoramic modes; ease of use; rechargeable battery; price
Cons: Wish the preview screen had a cover! Slight over-exposure in very bright light.
I really like this camera - and auto mode is truly automatic! It changes from macro to landscape in an instant. The panoramic mode is fun to use and produces great pictures. Clarity in still shots is remarkable. If you're looking for a reasonably priced point and shoot, the H-55 will serve nicely. You won't have to buy a million AA batteries either - the Sony battery is easily and quickly rechargeable. I owned a Sony before, and the technology in the H-55 is light-years beyond the old one.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great functionality and value in compact camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Functionality, compactness, price
This has become my go-to camera -- I rarely use my larger digital camera and mini-DV videocamera because the DSC-H55/B has the majority of their functions in a very light, shirt-pocket-sized body.
When traveling, I take it everywhere because it's so light and compact. The battery is postage-stamp sized, skinnier than a pencil, and recharge-able. If you tend to take hundreds of photos a day when traveling, carry an extra battery, as it weighs nothing and takes no space. The recharger is about the size of a deck of cards, but slightly thicker.
The 25mm lens can focus on objects as close as about 6 inches. Combined with a 10x optical zoom, this camera can take pictures of just about anything. It has settings for taking pictures at b ... eaches, of fireworks, and it has more obscure features like smile-detection settings.
The 720p video is not as fine as mini-DV, but the convenience of having photos and videos in one place that is a snap to download more than outweighs the image quality loss. I don't have hours of time to organize photos and videos from more than one electronic device.
The panoramic photo feature is great for landscapes and kids will love it because, with practice, you can get one person to appear in a panoramic photo twice, once on the left side and once on the right side!
P.S. if you put your camera in your pants pocket, don't carry keys or other hard objects in that pocket, as the screen can get scratched. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A great camera for all members of the family
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, good price, manual mode, 10X zoom
Cons: Does not come with a camera case, you need to buy one separately.
I just recently bought this camera and there is much to learn. It has a manual mode over some other cameras that I looked at. You can simply leave in automatic and it takes good pictures. I bought the camera primarily for the 10X zoom lens. The smile feature is a bonus (the shutter clicks if it detects a smile from the subject). This camera was priced within the range that I wanted to spend and I still got features that are associated with higher priced cameras. I was sold on the camera when I found out it takes both SD and Memory stick media. Take this camera on your next vacation. I have not tested how long the battery is, but you can pick up an extra ... type G battery before heading out of town. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Sweep panoramic mode
Cons: Everything Else!!!!
Have been looking for a point and shoot for about three months now and this was the first of four that I bought. I went to bb and asked the guy there for a camera that would take pics in low lighting, had little lag time and took great pics. He said that this camera was the one. Then I found out that this is the camera with the sweep panoramic mode and that made me even more excited. Before buying I even checked reviews online to see that the reviews were mostly great so I thought I found a winner!!! Went back to the hotel (we were on a trip when it was purchased) and went crazy taking pics. The screen was very pixleated and the color was horrible. Loaded pics onto my laptop and found them to be blurry with horrible color. ... And when they weren't blurry they were pixleated. Took it back in the morning and they said there was something wrong with the camera so I tried again and exchanged it for a new one. Took pics the rest of the day with pretty much the same results, (just not as extreme as the first camera). The lag time is horrible on this camera also so taking pics of kids is kinda pointless because you will never get the shot you are trying to with how long it takes to load in between pics. Even outside the pics turned out very washed out and very blah. Best part of the camera was the panoramic sweep. That did work amazingly and was sooo super easy to do. I was very sad to return the camera but I did end up with a camera that was the same price as this one but in a whole other league!!!! Samsung TL220 is the way to go!!! I am head over heels in love with my TL220!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: For it's size and convenience, it is the best
Item.Review:
Pros: High quality pictures in a small convenient package.
Cons: The instruction manual (on the CD) is not the easiest for anyone looking for easy entrance into the advanced feartures.
As a Zeiss lens fan, this latest iteration in the point and shoot Sony is an excellent choice. The ability to now use multi-media in Sony products is an excellent advance. It does not replace my DSLR, nor is it intended to, but the convenience and quality allows me to capture many more "Sony" picture moments. The Panorama feature is a nice addition, especially when you are in a tight space situation and you want to capture the entire scene in one exposure. Using Photoshop, or similar post photo prep, with this 14.1 MPX still results in excellent resolution of edited pictures. Having a single fu ... nction multi cable is also very convenient. If extensive video is contemplated, an extra battery is recommended, otherwise a full day of sightseeing and pictures has not been a problem. In my experience, this model is far superior to the equivalent Cannon and Nikon, which I also had occasion to use. It appears to come down to the Zeiss lens married well to the electronics package. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: HD Video, 10x Zoom, Panoramic Image Capture ,Price, Ease of Use

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Much better than what we had
Item.Review:
Pros: Lots of features, great zoom, great quality pics
Cons: Too many features(?) flimsy construction
We had an older Sony CyberShot camera that had (by today's standards) poor resolution and no features. We loved it, but it was beginning to have issues and the pictures weren't as great as what we were becoming used to seeing. This new camera blew the old one out of the water.
The faults of the new camera are in the complexity of the features which include all sorts of features that are more for gimmick appeal than actual usefulness (smile detector, etc). Additionally, the camera saves movies to a different file than pictures. Our previous camera used this file for just random information and settings. Unfortunately, after moving the pictures to a computer, we deleted ... the memory card not realizing that the movies weren’t transferred as well. Our computer did not realize it either and made no recommendations as to what to do with the remaining material (as it usually does). Needless to say, this complexity resulted in the loss of several movies that are irreplaceable.
I was also surprised with how flimsy the battery/memory stick-hole cover is. I’m sure I will break this sooner than later. Why would anyone put something that fragile on the bottom of a nice camera? What was Sony thinking? It is my belief that the battery and memory stick will stay in without this cover (once it breaks), but I will still be ticked off. Of course, this will also be a gaping hole in the bottom of the camera that will introduce dust, moisture, and other goblins to the innards of the camera.
The internal memory is both a positive and negative feature. I (frequently) forget to put the memory stick back in the camera and the internal memory holds about as much as a roll of film (remember those? 24 per role for those of you who don’t) and comes in handy for those moments you don’t want to miss, despite your best efforts. Unfortunately, we haven’t found a good way to transferring those pictures to the memory stick, but have to hook the camera up directly to download them. This is annoying, b ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a pocket sized camera that does alot more than point and shoot. I am used to a SLR camera so I wanted a bit of control, but I find it takes great pictures (very clear, good colour) even on auto mode. The 10X zoom is great, but you can get even closer using the digital zoom and the picture quality is still good. The movie feature was not a priority but I find I use it quite alot. While researching to purchase a small camera I found that this camera had alot of features, was reasonably priced, and had pretty good reviews. I am really happy with it and would highly recommend it.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: All good
Cons: Nothing
Excellent camera. Very good picture quality, 10x zoom is excellent. Great look and feel, not the smallest or lightest but that's good because it doesn't feel cheap and too compact in your hands like the smaller compacts.
Panorama mode is a plus and so is the HD movie mode. 3 in. screen is nice and big and battery life is pretty good.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Love this camera! Soooo glad I stumbled upon it!
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything, I LOVE this camera!!! Simple to use, simple to upload pics. Takes FANTASTIC pictures!
Cons: The ONLY thing I don't like about this camera is that you have to have a special battery and can't use AA, AAA, etc.
I bought this camera on Mothers Day, got the battery charged, started taking pics and haven't put it down since. I absolutely LOVE this camera! It is EVERYTHING that I was hoping to find in a camera and more. We had a Sony Cybershot years ago, around 4-5 yrs, and got rid of it after the pics immediately after our daughters birth were fuzzy. It was the last straw and we were done with the camera. Needless to say, I was VERY skeptical to buy another Sony Cybershot. I am sooooo glad I decided to buy this camera because it has lived up to everything I wante ... d and was looking for in a camera. It is incredibly easy to learn how to use it. Pretty much just take it out of the box and start taking pics. The panoramic mode is awesome! It's a really neat feature. It is very small and compact and easily fits in a case in my purse, which was the main thing I was looking for. Small camera that had good zoom, good MP, and just overall took good pics. This camera does everything I hoped for. The only thing I don't necessarily like is that you have to use special batteries. I am the type that likes the ability to have the option to use regular batteries should the battery die, and you do not have that option with this camera. You can buy another battery for around $50 and always carry around the extra one. I can't be disappointed in the life of the battery though. It surprisingly has lasted MUCH longer than I anticipated, so it may not be such a bad thing overall. We were able to take 20 minutes of video and a couple hundred pics on one charge. I was really impressed with that, but will definitely be buying an extra battery as soon as I can. Overall, I love this camera. It has met every expectation I had in looking for a new camera and I am incredibly thankful that a Best Buy employee pointed me in the direction of it. I couldn't be happier with this purchase and without a doubt would, and already have, recommend/ed this camera to anyone in the market for a new one. expand » « collapse

Very pleased with camera quality, size, and features. Video camera has great steady shot feature and zoom is allowed while filming. Nice zoom for getting closer to the subjects being shot. I bought this camera because I was looking for a nice digital video that took good stills but nothing had a flash, so I changed my focus for a nice camera that took great video and found this. Other than forced to use the Sony battery and charger, all other features of this camera are just what I was looking for. The camera is a bit larger and heavier than the smallest in this class, but with 14.1 MP and the size of the zoom, it is great and beats carrying my old 8MM video camera and digital camera ... to family events. The output of this camera is outstanding and I recommend it if you can afford it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Does many things for a good price
Cons: Flash too strong for indoor photos
I haven't fully explored the capabilities of the H-55 but so far it has met or exceeded my expectations. I wanted a relatively small small camera with at least ten X optical zoom and ease of use. The zoom and picture clarity has been fine. The panoramic feature is wonderful and easy to use. I haven't done much with the video function but from what I have done it is much better than my OLD video camera (and I do mean old). I am still printing out the user's manual of over 120 pages since I want a hard copy to refer to. So far, so good. The Best Buy price online with free shipping made it hard to pass up The local stores did not have the camera so I had to go elsewhere to see and try it.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, look, sweep panorama- for outside only
Cons: Picture quality, mode setup
I bought this camera to take as a 2nd camera for a photography trip (I also own a Nikon SLR). I bought it primarily because it of the optical zoom and I figured I could get a nice point-and-shoot for cheaper than another lens for my SLR. The panorama feature also seemed really cool
I haven't been on the trip yet, but after the few days of just playing with it I'm a little underwhelmed. The panorama is cool but when I used it inside and uploaded it onto my computer it looked practically VGA-quality. Even in good lighting I'm surprised this camera has 14.1 megapixel. I shudder to think what pictures in full optical zoom will look like.
The features and controls are easy to ... get a hang of. I feel as though some of the modes are redundant though, I'm not sure what the difference between "Easy" and "Auto" is and whatnot.
I've never owned a Sony but I've used my friends and have always been really impressed. Now I'm thinking I should have gone with the Nikon Coolpix S8000 as I originally wanted. I'm a huge reader of reviews though, and the Sony just seemed better based on that
Bottom line: Not a bad camera. Looks good, easy to use, cool panorama feature, nice large diplay screen. A little slippery to hold if I had to be picky. A good point and shoot. Just thought I'd get more for the money-- I feel a 150 dollar camera could've achieved the same results expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: zoom, compact size, typical sony setup, sweep panorama mode, easy mode, compatible with SD cards
Cons: lack of color modes such as black and white and sepia, lack of sunset scene mode
I am in love with the Sony H55. As an amateur photographer who mostly enjoys taking photos for the memories they capture this is beyond the perfect camera for me. I had outgrown my old Sony and was craving more from my camera and between the high zoom, rich colors, and easy mode this camera is more than I'll ever need. As an added bonus this Sony can actually take SD cards and who can complain about the 14.1 megapixels and 720p videos. I also love the compact size for such a powerful camera.
Although this camera is great, it is always a nuisance that Sony uses proprietary output con ... nectors. Also I was disappointed that this camera did not have some of the features that my old Sony had like black and white mode and sunset scene mode to name a few. Also, a more significant downfall is that pictures can become grainy without the flash.
Most of my complaints with this camera are superficial and I am very content with my purchase. I wouldn't trade this camera for any other (in this price range). expand » « collapse
