Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good overall point and shoot with 10x optical zoom
Item.Review:
Pros: Automatic mode takes good pics, fast boot up time, sweep panoramic mode, takes SD card
Cons: Flimsy battery cover, no sunset scene mode, proprietary computer/AV connection (no USB)
I've gone through 4 cameras in a week. I started out with the new Canon SX210 which was great, just a little too big and heavy for what I needed, then two Kodak M580s (which both had different serious defects). Now here I am with the Sony. It was down to either this or the Panasonic FH22, and the Sony had a better optical zoom in the same rough size. The camera is easy to use and the menu system is overall intelligently laid out. In Intelligent mode, they hide access to more manual functions to keep things simple, but they are there (and handy) once you switch to Manual. Sony finally switched ... to allowing their cameras to accept SD cards, thankfully. The battery life is rated at 310 shots, which is good. If I get 250 out of that, I'll still consider myself happy.
The camera is comfortable to hold and seems sturdy. There is a small indent on the right side on the back for where your thumb goes. Surprisingly, it's quite comfortable and makes holding the camera one-handed a breeze if you want to take a quick shot of something that catches your eye.
Picture quality is good and from what I've seen, overall noise-free.
Here are a few features I've come across that are actually pretty slick. First, sweep panoramic mode. Instead of having to take 3-4 shots independently and make sure you line them up as you turn from left to right, you turn on Sweep Panoramic and press the shutter once, then turn. The camera stitches it all together on the fly. It's pretty cool. Another is the burst picture mode. It keeps taking pics while the shutter is pressed. NOTE: Get yourself a Class 6 SD card. With a class 4, I can get 4 shots off pretty quickly, but then it slows down quite a bit. This camera also has a Smile Detection feature which will take a picture when a smile is detected. You can set it for Slight Smile, Normal Smile or Big Smile, so you should be covered. Another feature that I haven't seen before is the option to set priority for which type of face to focus on, child or ad ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera is conveniently sized and seems very intuitive to use. I haven't taken many shots yet but I am impressed what I have seen so far. The only negative I would give it concerns the operating manual. The booklet that comes with the camera just gives basic info like how to load the battery/memory card and identifies all the buttons and switches. All other info is on a cd so you have to have your computer available to learn all the tricky stuff. Either that or have a photographic memory.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Compact size and weight. Takes some great pictures. Purchased for holiday use as DSLR wasnt always appropriate. The HD video was the best feature. The panorama sweep feature was simply great at the Grand Canyon

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I stick this camera in my pocket and go. It takes wonderfully clear photos! The panorama feature is so much fun. Instructions are easy to read and remember. It is full of features. The big zoom ability is fabulous, and the pictures are clear even when the lens is zoomed all the way. The video works great. Megapixels are the feature I was most looking for in a pocket camera and this one hit the jackpot. I love it.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: 14.1 Megapixels, 10x zoom, 3" LCD, Good battery life, G lens, Easy to use, Feels Solid
Cons: Small lag between taking picture and it showing on the LCD but not a real problem, only 1.8 pictures per second
I just picked this camera up yesterday ($170) and have taken over a hundred pictures. I am going on a trip to China this summer and wanted a fairly light camera with a good zoom and takes good quality pictures. It may be a little heavier than I want for traveling, but that's a small trade off for the quality and features that this camera has. So far I like everything about it. Takes great videos, and allows you to zoom while you are recording. Sweep Panorama is super easy and fun to use. Manual mode lets you make many changes to aperture, shutter speed, iso level, e ... xposure. Intelligent Auto chooses scenes automatically and works very well. Smile detection works well as well as the face recognition. I also looked at the Nikon Coolpix S8100, the Panasonic Lumix ZS7, and the Sony Cyber-shot DSC HX5V. S8100 has about 3 times the LCD resolution and bigger zoom, ZS7 is cheaper, HX5V has GPS, Compass, and Gyro. They all have their own qualities, but as far as one day of use goes I am glad I made the purchase I did. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Purchase of a Sony DSC-H55 Digital Camer
Item.Review: I use the camera for general photo taking, as I am not a profesional photographer. The camera is light, compact and easy to use. It takes great pictures and has an awesome panoramic photo option. The cons of this camera is the battery life, shutter and processing speed. Other than that it is a great camera giving you great value for your money.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I use this for point and shoot applications and for home videos. I haven't tried all of the features yet. Some have complained about the poor quality of photos in low light, but after playing with the setting a little I have not had this problem. My only complaint is that the battery life is very short. The battery seems to drain more than it should even when the camera is left off. I think this is a design flaw.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: small size, good resolution
Cons: processing speed/delays
Bought this camera to replace an incomprehensible Canon. Went with Sony because they are typically more user friendly.
This one was priced right but a few major drawbacks. The delay in photo and video processing leads to bad shots is the big one. We just can't seem to time it right. Could be a setting but gosh knows how to change that.
The other is the ridiculous amount of time I just spent loading and upgrading their 198 megs (seriously?) of software. (the good news is it gave me down time to write this review) The software itself if not as user friendly as you would hope.
Was hoping this camera was it. Probably not but we'll give it another chance.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Found good price and works great for me.
Cons: Movie files can be a problem, but do your homework.
I Iove this camera, high megapixels and high zoom. I find this camera easy to use and I don't regret buying it. It does not come with a neck strap[it's light enough for me]. I made one using a 30 lb stainless,6" fishing leader, folded it in half, slid it behind the pin and I looped a heavy, soft shoe lace[neck lanyards may work also] through both loops. Neck straps are hard to find, especially for these cameras with a small strap holder. Another obstacle is the mp4 format that the movies are recorded in. The newer computers will recognize and save the files. I can burn a dvd but it won't play on cheaper or older dvd players. I'm still experimenting with the sof ... tware. Some of the photo labs will not put the movie files[mp4] on the cd. It may be on their dvd. Don't erase your media unless you can see them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small Package and high quality pictures
Cons: Battery life
This is a good camera if you want to stay with just a point and shoot. It has good zoom features. I would say you will want to buy a spare battery as it uses special battery so nice to have a spare when away from home.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, pictures, rechargeable and fits in your pocket.
Cons: Nothing.
I had forgotten to pack my SLR camera on my last vacation. I arrived at my destination and purchased this camera at Best Buy. Forget the inexpensive price of this camera. This Sony took great pictures. It was quick and easy to use in taking multiple pictures and downing loading them to my computer was easy. I like the fact that the batteries are rechargeable and that the camera is compact, sturdy and fits in your pocket. The cons: maybe the battery life could have lasted longer. I took hundreds of pictures, so I was satisfied. Aloha...

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This Sony 14pix camera takes great pictures, easy to use for someone that doesn't know all the techinal stuff. It has got photo software that is really cool. The zoom lense is awesome, the camera is small and light-weight. If you want great pictures without all the fuss, just use the auto program and the camera adjusts everything for you. I would recommend this. Also panaramic pictures! It's not complicated.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for the beginner w/some pro-features
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture Quality
Cons: Panoramic picture quality
I bought it, charged it up and used it and still have not opened the manual. The camera takes excellent pictures and the sweeping panoramic is incredible. I love that it gives you some shutter options in manual mode similar to the SLR models that cost $200.00 more. I would recommend this to anyone who likes to shoot an occasional video as well but does not want to invest in a video camera separately. The video is very good also.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use, excellent pictures
Cons: Nothing - it's all good
I do not use cameras much and feel intimidated by too many buttons and settings. This camera was easy for me to use and takes excellent pictures. It's a good size to carry and the battery lasts a long time. Highly recommended

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Image quality. Zoom and image stabilization.
Cons: Zoom during video.
I bought this camera as a second to my DSLR. This Sony has great picture quality and acts as a great camcorder also. The one negative is zooming during video recording. The sound of what ever you are recording cuts out for a few seconds. I tried doing some recording of a KISS concert and noticed after the fact. Within a few days I went to another show and didn't zoom. Vwala... No sound degradation. The image stabilization is also a big plus. The 10x optical zoom is great and does not blur the pictures at all. Battery seems to last a long time too and is easy to charge with the wall plug kit included. The extra charge feature does help with extended charge. Over all this is great camera. Two days after ... buying this camera, my daughter went out and picked one up too. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent camera with some professional features
Item.Review:
Pros: Its features
Cons: It is rather bulky
This camera has a group of features that make it an excellent tool for an amateur or professional photographer. You can produce HDR photos with the appropriate software and the intensity feature. Panoramas come out good and the video option has good quality. the battery has a long life giving you a long time to take your pictures. It is a little heavy and bulky compared to other cameras that really do not have all these features.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The features and size.
Cons: Nothing so far.
This camera was bought for a 75 year old friend. She loves it! She can finally take photos and they turn out no matter how shaky she is. It is very easy for her to zoom in and focus on the subject. The screen is big enough that she can now see the subject and it be in the photo.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent action shots, HD video, battery life and overall pic quality.
Cons: Noting important. Usually little things are due to user error, learn to use your settings : )
I did some research and read tons of reviews but still learned very little, too many choices! Ran down to best buy and picked up the Sony Cyber Shot W370.....took it back the next day. Horrible Zoom & pic quality. Found a web link somehow that asked me every question possible and narrowed down my needs to 5 cameras that were best for me. I ended up getting the H55 just days before my river trip, I LOVE IT! Excellent battery life; action shots especially on the boat; HD video and overall pic quality! I just downloaded all the pics and videos and I'm SUPER pleased! I took over 200 pics and 5 videos, ... only 2 shots were blurry..."USER ERROR!" I'm VERY thankful I took the other camera back, this was my best investment ever. You never want to play around with the quality of a pic, you may never get another chance at that shot! Also, Best Buy price matched and I only paid an extra $30. Great Camera and easy to use features. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use. and battery last for some decent time
Cons: no ON button for flash, only AUTO
This camera is pretty sweet. I like everything about it. Except one thing but its not a big deal. The panorama thingy is pretty cool. You get to choose how big you want your pictures to come out, and videos.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera and very low cost
Item.Review:
I had an older Sony Cyber-shot and I really liked my camera. But then my camera was stolen so I ordered the new Sony Cyber-shot H55 and I love it! I received it just before a trip to NYC and was able to take some great shots with the panoramic view. The wide lens allowed me to take full view photos. And it's got 10 times zoom, so I was able to get some great shots at a concert and it looked like the performer was right in front of me.
It's so easy to use and turns on and off fast so you don't miss your shot. You can shoot long videos and can zoom in the video setting, which I couldn't do on my old camera. It also has a feature that accommodates your shaking hands, so you don't see it in the video or picture. The camera was lower cost than my basic cyber-shot was a few years ago and ... it does so much more. I love this camera! It's so easy to use. So far I haven't found any cons really other than it's a little larger than my last camera, but that's it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Big Results in a Small Package
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and Zoom
Cons: Weak flash when used in large rooms
Great camera for the price. Packs a 10x Optical Zoom Lens, Uses both the SD Cards and Sony card, Panoramic picture is easy and fun to use. After shopping around and looking at many cameras, this one has it all and I got it for a great price, on sale at Best Buy! Fits in your pocket and battery lasts till about 300 shots. Really good for all occasions.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Compatible with old SDcard
Cons: Picture quality on screen
I went with this camera after initial reviews at dpreview.com but turned out to be not so good. The picture output was not satisfactory with low lights. Night vision on screen was too grany. Battery shutter was too weak and always at risk to be broken.
Good part of the camera was i could try it out with my old SDcard and didnt had to buy Sony's memory card.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Sleek Design, Great Display, Easy Functions
Cons: Picture Quality is terrible!
I recently bought this camera for my wife's birthday to replace our 3 year old other product. She really didn't like the size of the camera nor did she think that it took good pictures(I disagreed with both points, however, I wanted to make her happy since she uses it 80% of the time). I did a ton of research online and then went to the store. The Best Buy employee was extremely helpful and highly recommended the camera to me. I took several pictures on different setttings and on the very nice sized LCD display, they all looked great so I bought it. The first set of pictures that we took at home came out poor, but we chalked that up to new camera and just getting use to it. Mind you, I am no ... expert photographer but I love taking lots of pictures and knew that this was not a user error. We pushed on and the next day we started taking tons of pictures of our 2 little girls. We were lucky if 25% of the pictures came out DECENT!!!. I was so thoroughly disappointed in this camera. It is sleek, has easy to use functions, a great display and overall for the $$$ I thought it was a pretty good deal. Was I wrong. I also have come to find out why I would avoid Sony in the future. We originally had been using a 1 GB SD card with our old camera and will give Sony credit for finally getting on board. The problem was that Best Buy was running a deal on a bundle of camera, 4 GB Memory Stick ProDUO and case so I bought that. My wife is realizing right now that when you leave the cable at home 500 miles away that the memory card does not fit into our laptop.
Again, very disappointed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: great shots, li-ion battery, 10x zoom, ect
Cons: average battery life, dotted LCD.
I've got a Nikon point-and shoot camera for four years and I think it needs to be replaced. I've been looking for one that fits my budget till I see this Cybershot. It takes very good pics in daylight and good ones in dimmer conditions. Nevertheless, the LCD has a minor problem with scattered dots while viewing images, battery life lasts for about 200 shots with highest brightness setting. Plus, the tripod socket locates on the right may make it imbalance when used with a tripod. Overall, there are many advanced improvements that is found on this point-and-shoot camera. I prefer it to my old Nikon one.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, ease of use, 720P video is good
Cons: wide - telephoto adjustment speed is slow, shutter lag, Display blacks out after all pictures for over a second
I bought this camera for the summer vacation. I'm using it now to get familiar with it. So far this is what I found. This is a good camera for non-action related photo's. The image quality is great. The camera is easy to use and movies are nice. If you are looking for a simple to use camera then this is it. After I bought the camera, I came home took pictures of my wife and kids and they look great. However, if you are looking to use this camera to capture sports action then there are some things to consider. First, the telephoto zoom is really slow. In my son's soccer game I would zoom in to get the pl ... ay on the opposite side of the field, but when the ball came over to my side the zoom was so slow I couldn't keep up to get any pictures. Second, Shutter lag is significant. Maybe I'll get better at anticipating the play and account for the shutter lag, but for now I miss a lot of good shots. Finally, the display blacks out when you take pictures. If you have burst mode on, you will not see what pictures you are taking. For this one, maybe I'm missing something but it is annoying. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great pics, Great video, Great ZOOM>
Cons: To change some settings you need to entrer into the menu.
Best camera than I had, great zoom great colors.......................

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Editing feature
Normally I do a lot of research on things before I buy but I bought this camera on a whim. I LOVE it! The options are great. Takes excellent picture in low light. I have 3 small children and I am able to capture great pictures with them in motion. I love the editing options on the camera. The fact that you can lighten and darken skin tones directly on the camera saves so much editing time after they are uploaded to the computer! I would highly recommend this product

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Lots of pixels, many features, great HD movie mode @ 720.
Cons: When you take photos and press the shoot button, it takes a couple seconds to reset unless in burst or continuous mode
This is really a good versatile little camera. This will probably be the last Point N Shoot I buy as the pixels in tablets and smartphones increases.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: wide angel lens, picture quality, panorama feature
I love the wide angel lens and the panorama feature. You can also use two different types of memory card with it

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Bought and used before trip. Light weight and easy to handle with my unsteady hands and to see with the large screen. Made great shots at dusk and sunsets. GREAT zoom feature for flowers.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pictures are of good quality but I dislike the lag time from when you take the picture to when you can view it on the screen. My other cheaper Sony cybershot cam did not do this. Great pics even at dim light. Hate the video. Very choppy when viewed.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture Quality
Cons: understanding features
Sony finally got with the times and ditched their propreitary format which if they had not, I would never have purchased it. This is an SD card which I like to be able to pop out on trips and readily back up to my laptop in case my camera gets lost, damaged, or stolen.
I haven't delved in to advance options so I've only been using the basic easy shots. Most photos have been great, but I have had a few blurry ones if you don't focus/hold it just right.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera overall, low light ok
Item.Review: owned this camera for about a few weeks. took great pictures in DC. Panorama shots are cool and easy to take. Shutter speed is great; low light pictures not that great, but still learning the camera controls. video looks great and reason I bought it was the ability to zoom in during video recording. case is somewhat bulky, so you may need to get something different.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good camera for the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, picture and video quality
Cons: Battery, not a standard AAA or AA
I'm very happy with this camera. Small enough size to be able to fit in a pocket. The pictures and video are great. Overall very happy with this purchase.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Ease of use
Cons: slow, grainy picture, inaccurate color.
I'm not a professional photographer, just a regular guy wanting an easy to use camera. I will try not to make any judgment, just present the facts.
1) SLOW!, there is good 3-5 seconds lag time before second shot can be taken. 2) SLOW! When deleting a picture, it takes few seconds to think about it 3) SLOW! after taking the picture, your hand will have to hang at the same pose for about a second before you can move it, otherwise your picture come out blurry. 4) GRAINY! Picture came out very grainy, whether indoor, outdoor, with or without flash, auto or manual mode. Geek squad guy took a look and took several picture himself and checked it out for good 5-10 minutes and concur that the picture quali ... ty is stunningly bad. 5) COLOR! It's off! it generally give you the correct color but always off by a bit. My 2 years old Canon SD1100 had better color than this.
Feature was simple enough, anyone that knows how to use a cell phone can use this camera within 5 seconds of picking it up. It has been returned.
Even though the camera was not broken, Duarte Bestbuy was stunned by the horrible quality of picture they waived the 15% restocking fee, thank you! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Simply a best pack of features
Item.Review: This is simply a best pack of features (10X, 14.1MP) but most importantly for a reasonable price. Most people said in reviews that it has a washed look at the dark light photoes. But i would say its there in all point and shoot cameras. For me night time also giving good shots. Very clear. I would recommend this to anyone without any hesitations.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: THIS CAMERA IS MY NEW BEST FRIEND
Item.Review: THIS CAMERA WAS SO NICE AND COMPACT YET ENABLED ME TO TAKE EXCELLENT TELEPHOTO SHOTS. I JUST TOOK IT TO EGYPT AND IT PERFORMED BEAUTIFULLY! IT JUST WAS SO EASY TO USE AND THE FEATURES TO BE ABLE TO EDIT THE PICTURE RIGHT IN THE CAMERA WERE WONDERFUL. IT WILL GO WITH ME EVERYWHERE NOW AND I WON'T MISS THOSE UNEXPECTED SHOTS BECAUSE I DIDN'T FEEL LIKE DRAGGING MY LARGER CAMERAS AND ALL THE LENSES. LOVE IT LOVE IT LOVE IT !!!!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features
Cons: Can mess up settings with too many options
My first pictures were coming out over-exposed... so I played with the settings. You really need to read every page of the manual on the disk. The camera works well, but it is easy to click on a setting that will throw the whole camera off. If this happens, click on "initialize" and start all over with re-setting date, etc.
I dropped my first camera at a Rental Car Counter... bad news... plastic rim had a chip... sold the camera at a used camera store for $50 and bought a second camera. The dropped camera still worked. I just didn't like it that the camera had been dropped. I didn't buy the accidental coverage the first time.
So, the lessons learned are: don't drop the camera, and be sure to know wh ... at you are doing when you change settings.
The panarama feature works well, but the height of the photo is kind of skinny. You can bracket the exposure which is a feature that is not usually on point and shoot cameras. Also you can shoot continously instead of a single image. This is good for sports or action.
This is a good camera for a beginner and advanced amateur. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Average ~ no different than other brand's cameras
Cons: What you see is not what you get
Aside from a few other dislikes about this camera such as unnatural coloring when 'auto', the tenancy to stretch the picture like it was a fish-eye lens, and difficulty in macro focusing... I have had a number of times when it didn't record the movie I was trying to get. This is because of the way the camera communicates that it is started/stopped recording. Pressing the shutter to start the recording displays a small red "Rec" in the corner. Pressing it again displays a large red ribbon across the screen saying "Recording...". ...which tells me that the recording has begun, especially when I double-tapped the shutter button, didn't realize it, thought it was "Recording...", and the ... n quickly held the camera above my head to film the action (viewfinder out of my site). Sony needs to seriously fix this so as not to allude to "Recording..." when in fact it has "Stopped Recording". [grrrr!] Yes, I've learned from this and won't have it happen again but why should I have to? I'm going back to Canon for cameras. I never had any complaints with theirs. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: camera was received on time and was in good shape. Comes with a small start up manuel. Full manuel is on disk that came with camera and can be used on-line or printed out. I owned an old cyber-shot camera and this camera works a lot better and has more features. I have not tried all of the features and may never use them all. I like to just point and shoot and this camera sets everything auto so works well for me.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not a true point and shoot
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, 10X optical zoom
Cons: Requires manual EV adjust for outdoor shots, SONY battery
I purchased this camera because I used to shoot with a Sony Cyber-shot that produced really nice photos without a lot of fuss. This new camera is not a simple point and shoot. Almost all the pictures I take outside require compensating for lighting or the shot is overexposed. Regardless of using the 'easy' mode, 'intelligent auto adjust' mode or scene mode, the EV needs to be adjusted by -.7 to -1.3 or the shot is overexposed. This is very inconvienient and you run the risk of missing a good shot unless you remember to change the EV. This camera also was defective when I originally purchased it. A fine vertical line appeared in the photos when I zoomed in with greater than 5X magnific ... ation. Also, I would much rather use rechargeable AA batteries vice the SONY rechargeable battery. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good things in a small package
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice improvements over other Sony cameras.
Cons: There is such a thing as too many features.
This is my third Sony digital point and shoot. Some nice improvements including the ability to use SD card in addition to Memory Stick. Overall a very nice camera for the money.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The video, price, look of camera
Cons: picture quality, flash, screen image quality
I've been looking for a camera to buy for my boyfriend, and this one has good video quality and sounded like it took great photos. However when we got it, and tested it out, it fell far from expectations. We first tried the panorama, it greats but it has a bubbled effect in the middle. They still need to work on that aspect of the camera. The video is awesome, the only reason I would have kept it. Good zoom and amazing quality. We took some portrait shots and tried many different setting trying to make it look better. They were either to bright, too dark or when it was nice lighting it was poor quality pictures. Then I tried to capture him jumping his bicycle and every one wa ... s blurry no matter what settings. Even burst didn't capture a good enough shot. The screen had a very pix-elated look and had kind of a blurry look to it. I returned this camera and I definitely would not recommend it to anyone. Hope this helps =) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a Photo Enthusiast who has owned Sony products for over 8 years now. With DSC-H55 I was looking for a compact camera that had the best Optical zoom I can get from a Point and Shoot Camera. Comparing a similar product from Canon and Nikon, I decided to go with Sony because of its easy use, rechargeable batteries and Wide zoom feature. Having a lot of fun with this baby!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This Sony compact camera is in my opinion a good money for the value. The reason why I bought it is because I want a pack of good features in a user-friendly camera and I have had a good Sony camera's experience so far. The best features are the 14MP and the 10x optical zoom lens. The 720p video is also a great add to this camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, Sweep Panorama
Cons: Shutter lag
I bought this camera for sweep panorama feature. Overall, I am happy with the camera so far. But I am disappointed with the shutter lag time. I am missing my new born baby's action. Also be aware that this camera needs Sony's proprietary cable ( not the mini USB) to connect with the computer.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a great camera for the money!!
Item.Review:
Pros: 10x optical zoom and sweep panorama mode.
Cons: Lag time in the shutter release.
I've been using Sony point & shoots for years and they just keep improving. I got this one because I wanted a little higher ZOOM without having to bring along my Sony DSLR. Having the 10X optical zoom is awesome... really brings you closer to things without giving up clarity. This is the first camera I've had with the "sweep panoramic" and it's a really nice feature. Bought this just beore leaving for a cruise and it was cool to sweep the entire port and beachline while we floated around the Western Caribbean. Haven't played with many of the features, but so far... so good. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat. The only thing I'm not loving is the lag time from when I push the shutter button ... to when the camera actually takes the picture. With a three year old grandbaby, I miss some of the most wonderful faces because of lag time - this camera is no worse than other point and shoots I've owned, but no better either. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great color! Fast Auto Focus. Love the sweep panorama mode. Smile detector really works. It has a fairly quick recovery time between shots in Auto mode. I wanted a camera I could hand to anyone and get a clear non blurry photo. Yay!! It works!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Price, Features, Function
Cons: On Off Button location and sensitivity
The Sony Cybershot DSC-H55 is a great camera for the cost. High Megapixel 14.1. Lots of good features including one shot panoramic pictures. Easy to use. Very good pictures in various condictions and lighting.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: completely satisfied with sony cyber-shot camera
Item.Review:
Pros: high quality pix (14megapixels)
Cons: carrying case
After examining many camera's across a wide price range I selected this Sony Cyber-shot Digital camera. the Picture Quality is excellent, lens and shutter speed is quite sufficient fore almost every need or use as my recent trip to Las Vegas & the Grand Canyon will attest too.
I bought it as a package with expanded memory card, extra battery & carrying case, this saved a few dollars. Only knock is the case is a tad small of this camera. Camera fits but extra battery makes for an extremely tight fit to the point where you are concerned about trying to fully zip the case without it ripping. Camera and the other parts are all A-OK! I'd recommend it.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Video is excellent.
Cons: Glare can obscure the screen, making a foto difficult.
When I first started with this camera I had problems with the size. I was used to camera's a bit bigger/bulkier. But as I got used to it I found it performed quite well. Biggest problem was not having a viewfinder, but I managed. I don't need to carry the instructions as it is quite simple to manage the setting. Sunlight on the screen can be a problem, but so far it's the only on I've found. A good camera to carry around for all purpose use.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great EASY to use, high quality camera
Item.Review:
Pros: All around...Great. Price, functions, ease of use
I want my electronics to do a lot without being difficult. This camera is great! The panoramic function is fun. You really get more out of each shot. The battery life is super long! I recommend this to anyone.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera falls way short. A 14mp camera, yet photos are quite grainy, even in full Phoenix, AZ summer sun. The flash is right in front of the wide-tele switch, so you will often cover the flash. And the flash is quite useless, no power at all, forget anything beyond 4ft. The panoramic shot, while really neat feature, is a typical picture cropped to a small strip, so the picture goes down to about a 2mp quality. I used to own a Sony DSC-707 and it took much better pictures than this one.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Picture quality, ease to use
Cons: No "on" feature for the Flash (auto setting). It's only auto & off
Purchased this camera as a bundle special in June. Great price! I just returned from a trip (Jamaica & Cayman Islands) and the pictures came out wonderful! Vivid colors and picture quality is good! The only I would like is for the automatic settings to allow you the ability to change the flash to "on". The flash is only has the auto & off function (very minor complaint). I'm pleased the camera. Still exploring all of the features on the camera). One unique feature I am really enjoying is the music feature when viewing the pictures in a slide show.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This is a Great camera for anyone
Item.Review:
Pros: Intelligent auto, movie mode, smile feature, price
Cons: If I set the camera correctly I have not found anything wrong yet.
I bought my Sony camera a few weeks ago and, I am still learning more about this camera each day. I have found this camera to be a very good all around camera. The flash is out of the way of your fingers and, the battery last quite a while. If you want you can buy the white charger which will charge your lithium battery about twice as fast as the supplied black charger. I learned that I needed to buy a fast memory card so, I started with an SDHC class iv but I want the fastest which would be the Sony duo HG memory card so I will be able to take pictures faster. This camera can be easy to use but, be carefull with program auto or, manual as they are ... a bit more complicated. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Well, I got this camera after reading some reviews out there. I confirmed that they are true... The images show a lot of noise on the screen when shooting indoors. Greatest advantage is the zoom. I also found that the videos are quite better than I expected in really low light. I filmed a night light parade at disney and the videos look good. However in daylight i found the video quality to be mediocre. I have a canon sd780 and the video mode is significantly better than the sony. I would say it's a pretty avarage camera. and would recomend it only to the people that want to shoot tourist pictures, general things and people in front of land marks. That's it. The panorama mode is great, but only works with lowresolution..

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: 10x optical zoom
Cons: low-light image quality
Researched cameras for my dad & found this gem. After ~15 minutes of using his camera, ended up buying one for our family road trip. It was bundled with extra battery & case for ~$250. Panorama feature is pretty cool & was used extensively on our trip to nat'l parks. Self-timer allowed for "family photos" along the trip as well. 10x optical zoom is fantastic / works well with steady-shot -- helps see detail (when reviewing pics) that you didn't realize was there. Marginal low-light image quality, but would definitely recommend.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: See "My Review" above.
Cons: See "My Review" above.
I really think this is a great camera! Especially for its price! It just takes time getting used to, and knowing the camera. One thing I do not like however is where the flash is located. Although it’s on the front of the camera (like all cameras), it is by the "shoot function" button. Because of this, you might easily, accidentally block or cover the flash with your fingers. That can result in a bad quality, dark photograph. But maybe this is just something that's curbed with time and practice! Overall, I think you’ll be happy with camera.
P.S. Prior to this camera, I was a loyal Cannon guy for years! I did not even like a Sony camera I was gifted back in 2004. But as of date, I’m happy with my Sony purchase. T ... his camera definitely lives up to Cannon quality, and compact.
P.S. II. This is not an ultra slim camera which easily fits in your pants pockets. It is a bit bulkier, particularly because of its zoom lens. I recommend a carrying case to keep it wrapped around your wrist or neck.
JM expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Nothing
I got my camera today and I absolutely love it! I had a Sony camera before for 2 years and lost it recently so I bought Sony H55. I was scared whether it might be good or not but it proved me wrong. It's crystal clear and the camera itself looks gorgeous (better in person than the pics online). The best feature is the panorama.. its so cool. If you're a Sony camera fan, you'll love it and the camera is worth the price. And also the shutter speed is fast.. you don't have to wait like 5 seconds to take the picture. The zooming is also very good. So, I would recommend any one to buy this camera especially if you're interested in photography. 5 stars from me! :)

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Clearity of pictures, features and ease of use.
Cons: Everything is great!
I just exchanged the Olympus Stylus for this one today and so far I'm satisfied with it. The picture is super clear, I love all the features such as the sweep panorama, smile detection and so on. It's super easy to use and is convenient due to it's smaller size. It's not replacing my Canon DSLR but its great for just everyday shooting so I don't have to bring that huge thing around with the lens and all.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The Panoramic Feature
Cons: Very short battery life, LCD screen has spots, everything becomes red, low quality pictures
This camera is one of the worst cameras I have ever bought. The pictures come out red, or fuzzy. There is a horrible delay, if you want to take a picture at that moment to catch something spectacular... you cant! Bought the camera to take for my vacation in Disney, I was so disapointed. In very bright sun light the pictures do come out better and the camera does snap faster (sometimes). Even outside they come out blurry. I had to take the same picture 3 or 4 times till it finally took a decent picture. There arent really any features on the camera besides the panaromic thing. Which is pretty cool, dont get me wrong, but the camera seems really cheap ... . Especially for the price. There are cheaper cameras with more features and better quality. The LCD screen has a big spot that came out of no where. Overall, its a very frustrating camera and so not worth the money spent. I'm returning it and getting myself a cannon. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The panoramic capture, no light pictures, SDHC card instead of standard Pro Duo
Cons: Battery life and lcd is a fingerprint magnet
Okay I purchased this camera after reading several reviews on it. I knew the battery life was not that great so I did not hesitate and purchased a second battery. First off right out of the box the camera took absolutely beautiful pictures outside. Crisp and clean. Once you get indoors you need to work with the settings a bit to get the best picture quality that you personally like. Overall a great camera. Can be used right out of the box. One of the major reasons I bought this camera was because I have always liked Sony personally but never cared for their memory cards. With this camera you have the option to use either the Pro Duo card or ... the SDHC. I also got this camera on sale as well so it was an even better deal. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: New features and the look
Cons: LCD screen fulll of dots, everything becomes red, low quality pictures
This camera is one of the worst cameras I have ever bought. I had polaroid five years ago and gave it out for making everthing blue. I have sony 7 MP it has beter pictures than this 14 MP also it has better abs clear LCD while this camera's LCD doesn't show real pictures it has dots jumping all over the screen. Pictures becomes red. In bright light it can give clear pictures but this scenario doesn't inldude taking picture inside a normal house or to a party or when not standing direct under the sun rays. This camera does not have quality better than low megapixels and cheap cameras. The manual mentions dots on LCD are normal to this model, but I wanted clarity of both ... pictures and LCD not dots. This was going to be my second Sony but I'm disappointed and shifted to panasonic 12 MP that is a bit expensive but it has nice pictures and is reliable. I did return Sony the next day. Dispite new features I wouldn't advice someone to buy this model even for a cheaper price. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for beginners, Good for pro's
Item.Review: I bought this camera to use at an upcoming wedding, but also to replace my old mega-zoom digital panasonic. This camera exceeded my expectations for a compact mega-zoomer. The colors are great, the shake-reduction technology is terrific and the sweeping panorama option is unique and it works well. As with all non-dslr, there is noise at low light, but still takes good shots if you give it time and up the iso. Overall, compact, long battery life, many options for memory (I went with an 8gig memory stick, but it will take sd cards) and easy camera-to-computer transfer make this a powerful compact mega-zoom and the HD video aint bad either.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It gives very good pictures as it has the power of 14 MP backed up by 10x optical zoom. We also have the provision to set the resolution/MP to a specific level e.g. 10MP. Really a good to have stuff. I tested it for recording video also ... gives MP4 format and good quality videos.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing camera for the money, sound is great too!
Item.Review:
Pros
This Sony camera is not only easy to use and has many customizable options, but it has been perfect for the live music shows and student events I document on a nearly-daily basis. Musicians who request footage from me after shows have been very vocal about how good the sound quality is, especially for such a light consumer camera.
Cons
The only problems I have had with the camera are under extreme conditions, such as poor lighting or heavy movement. This is not the camera's fault and is more of a consumer-camera issue than anything. It is not an SLR-replacement, so be aware that if you try to take still pictures in low light or with movement, blurring or graininess may occur.
As a Sony product, this item uses a memory card that may not be compatible with an ... y other brand so that may also be a con (though it will work with many Sony products, which can be considered a plus).
Overall Review
As a student on a budget who was in need of his first camera in order to take pictures and videos of events and shows, I can say that I am very happy with choosing this camera. This camera makes you want to use it, which is the best endorsement I can make.
Based on my experience with this camera, I want to stress the importance of buying two large memory cards (8 gigabytes each or higher) and an extra battery. If you intend on taking a lot of video, especially for live shows and events like I do, you will find it invaluable to have an extra card and battery in your pocket. Make sure to buy them on sale though. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Out of all tbe cameras I previewed the sony cyber shot is the best camera you could find. I love the sony panoramic setting is an amzing feature, its zoom is good. There is only one thing with the camera that I am not so impressed with, there is a lag between the time you press the button take a picture and the time the it actually take the picture. I find myself moving the camera to see if it is working properly just takes a few takes befor you get used to it. All and all a great camera for the price.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good Camera except for one problem.
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality of pictures and different settings
Cons: Weird half moon shape on the LCD screen that happened for no reason...
The camera I purchased was excellent besides the fact after having it for a month and using it on two different occasions this half moon spot appeared on my LCD screen as if something damaged it which was impossible since it was kept in the case and had not been dropped or anything. I brought it back to best buy and it has been sent out to have the LCD replaced rather then getting a factory reburbished camera. Hopefully this will fix the problem because I love the camera and was so sad to see that happened to it for some unknown reason.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: size, viewing screen, shooting speed
Cons: nothing yet.
This is a great camera. I previously owned a Sony Cybershot, but it was larger, and I was looking for a smaller camera. This one fits in my pocket, was very user friendly, and it shoots faster than my old one. I would recommend this camera. so far the battery is holding up well.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My new Sony camera is easy to use, good instructions. It is small with big features. It will be used on our future river cruise to Germany,and other parts of Europe. The prints will be okay to enlarge to poster size.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I appreciated this camera immediately since it took clear pictures of family members in poor light conditions. I was tires of grainy, unclear family photos. This camera, on automatic, chooses the best settings so I don't have to guess. I can just point and shoot indoors and out, in all kinds of light.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This camera bundle is worth the money!
Item.Review: I really enjoy this camera. It could use a few more features, but it is the perfect no nonsense, shoot anywhere without guess-work camera. I like the light weight and the picture clarity.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Features
Cons: Nothing yet.
My old Sony camera finally gave out and I temporarily replaced it with a Cannon and hated it. I bought this camera about a month ago and have yet to regret it. The pictures come out great. Even the ones taken in very low light. The menu is easy to understand.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Megapixels, great features, user friendly
Cons: battery life
Sony has always produced good cameras, this is another one. Im satisfied with the quality of pics it takes and how user friendly it is to operate. Only complaint is short battery life.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use
I didnt like using my husbands Nikon D-- SLR, to much camera for me, so he bought this for me for Christmas. I have used it several times in still photo and video mode. Luv it. Thanks.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great all around
Cons: No internal memory
I was shopping around for a well priced, high quality photo taking with a nice looking camera not bulky or large.... If you're looking for great pics with some nice features try this camera, No problems with it so far, It seems to be the camera I have been looking for. I have been looking for a camera like this for a long time, and it takes great 720p Video.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: nothing
Cons: everything
I had high hopes for the Sony H55, I even tried to force myself to like the picture quality. But... I just couldn't do it to myself. Reds, greens and blues are heavily saturated. Browns, oranges and reds all come out looking red. Flesh tones don't even look real. And it gets even worse when the flash is used. I wanted to upgrade cameras to have memories, the H55 takes reality and puts a fake color scheme over it. The zoom is good and so is the 3" screen, that is about it. Just returned it today. Save yourself the time and look elsewhere.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not good for fast photo shooting.
Item.Review:
Cons: bulky/heavy, slow, and blurry
I purchased two Sony 14.1 Cyber Shot cameras as Christmas presents for my daughters. We are very disappointed with the shutter speed. It takes about 8 seconds to take one photo. We recently visited the city, and it was impossible to take a group picture without it blurring. The colors were distorted, not defined and blurry. There's no way you can take candid action photos either. For example, if you see something you would like to capture with your new camera, it takes so long to shoot that your subject has already moved. I'm very disappointed and surprised at Sony, the Cyber Shot has one of the best lenses out there for it's size, but what good is a G lens if you are unable to take a good picture!

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use, holds battery charge
Item.Review:
Pros: Good picture, good battery life.
I love this camera, the battery stays charged for a long time so I'm not constantly trying to charge it. It's easy to use and small enough to fit in my pocket or purse. Would definately recommend if you want a good picture from a small camera.

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy in use.
Cons: Lens
This camera easy in use, has a big screen and bla bla bla, but biggest problem is lens! I bought this model only because I lost my previous Sony camera with Carl zeiss lens, and I really like it, but this one I want to return. So problem is, picture is stretched at the corners (like longer than normal).

Item.Item: Sony Cyber-shot DSC-H55 14.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
